logs.message: Windows path quoting fixed, Linux installer now uses SUDO_CMD, docs updated with envsubst guidance; shell lint deferred until shellcheck/shfmt available.
Initiating consolidated CI workflow redesign for testing/main branches.
Created ci-testing.yml with matrix lint/test, cross, and docs jobs; removed legacy ci.yml and ci-feature.yml.
Iterated on new workflow after initial failures (build order, shellcheck scope, serial test execution); trimmed shfmt/cross/dist steps for stability.
CI Testing workflow now green on main (Actions run 19081409401).
Re-enabled cross builds after gating telemetry cdylib on musl; wiring dist profile.
Adopted dist v0.30 plan/build pipeline via dist init; release workflow regenerated.
Enabled workflow_call on ci-testing.yml so nightly can reuse the consolidated matrix jobs.
Created nightly.yml with skip-aware preflight, dist plan validation, targeted replay/world-agent suites, and automated failure issue reporting.
Locally exercised ci-testing steps (fmt, clippy, build, test, doc); noted shellcheck/musl toolchain gaps on developer host and confirmed dist plan runs.
Added cargo rustc cdylib builds for telemetry on non-musl targets and restored cross job coverage for aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu with cdylib skip on musl.
Configured cross pre-build steps to install libseccomp for musl and GNU containers so telemetry and world crates link cleanly.
Gated seccomp baseline to non-musl targets and added runtime warning for musl builds to keep cross jobs green.
Nightly extended tests now run dist plan --ci github --output-format=json to validate packaging manifests while release artifacts remain exclusive to release.yml.
Plan confirmed: rewrite shell/PowerShell installers to download per-app cargo-dist archives and reconstruct the platform bundle locally, removing reliance on legacy fat tarballs.
Updated release.yml to trigger on v* tags, gate publishing on tag refs, and keep cargo-dist plan/build/host stages aligned with the support bundle extras.
Recorded pr-run-mode=skip in dist-workspace.toml so release CI stays off PRs while preserving the default cargo-dist regeneration flow.
Evaluated adding a release dry-run helper but decided to keep the workflow tag-only to reduce noise in the Actions list.
Scoped ci-testing.yml triggers to testing-only pushes/PRs so main builds rely on promotion + release workflows.
Added promote.yml with dry-run support, automated version bumping, CI guard checks, and optional tagging to fast-forward main from testing.
Documented that the current cargo-dist release only publishes substrate binaries; world-agent/forwarder/support bundles are missing so the new installers cannot succeed.
Updated RELEASE_PIPELINE_PLAN.md to reflect actual artifacts and copied canonical script references from commit e350bdb for the upcoming one-command installer redesign.
Enforced testing/main rulesets (status checks, approvals, no force pushes) and locked the production environment to release tags on main.
Split nightly scheduling into nightly-scheduler.yml so repository_dispatch events target testing while validation reuses ci-testing.
Resolved the tools/version-bump clippy regression and confirmed CI Testing run 19145605184/19153633587 succeeded on testing before promotion.
Switched promote.yml to use the PROMOTE_PUSH_TOKEN, set explicit commit statuses, and reran the workflow (Actions run 19153833384) to fast-forward main without rewriting tags.

Adjusted release.yml to match v*-style tags, allow customized CI via allow-dirty, and install libseccomp dependencies for Linux dist builds; release run 19153854458 on tag v0.2.0 completed successfully.
Captured the artifact/dependency matrix and Lima/WSL provisioning flow in RELEASE_PIPELINE_PLAN.md §3.5.1–3.5.3 so the installer acceptance criteria are explicit.
Outlined the cargo-dist multi-app blueprint (world-agent, forwarder, host-proxy, support bundle guardrails) in §5.1 to unblock release.yml changes.
Documented the installer download/verification plan plus doctor/smoke gating in §5.2 to prepare for the one-command UX rework.
Clarified that tag builds keep per-crate artifacts internal and publish only the aggregated per-target bundles + support archives, aligning §3.5.3 and §5.1 with the desired release UX.
Implemented assemble-release-bundles.sh, updated release.yml to run the bundler before publishing, and rewired installers to consume the new host bundles.
Ensured cargo-dist publishes substrate-shim alongside substrate (metadata + docs) so bundles include the PATH interceptor by default.

tasks.title: Harden installer scripts before CI overhaul
tasks.description: Fix Windows path quoting, remove hard-coded sudo usage in Linux installer, and sync INSTALLATION.md prerequisites so the automated workflows inherit reliable installers.
steps: Quote Windows path fragments in scripts/windows/wsl-warm.ps1 so $projectPath values with spaces survive (see lines 130-160).
Replace direct 'sudo' invocations in scripts/substrate/install-substrate.sh with the SUDO_CMD helper and rerun shellcheck.
Update docs/INSTALLATION.md with correct download host (GitHub releases) and macOS prerequisite envsubst.
Run shellcheck/shfmt across scripts/ to confirm no regressions.

tasks.title: Create consolidated CI workflow for testing/main branches
tasks.description: Replace legacy workflows with a single matrix-based pipeline that runs linting, unit tests, cross builds, and script checks on testing/main.
steps: Delete .github/workflows/ci-feature.yml.
Author .github/workflows/ci-testing.yml with triggers on push/pull_request targeting testing.
Define matrix job over ubuntu-24.04, macos-14, windows-2022 running fmt, clippy, cargo test, and per-platform smoke commands.
Add secondary job using houseabsolute/actions-rust-cross to build linux cross targets.
Add documentation-packaging job (cargo doc, dist plan validation, shellcheck/shfmt).
Ensure all jobs share caches keyed by OS and Cargo.lock hash.

tasks.title: Introduce skip-aware nightly validation workflow
tasks.description: Create nightly.yml that runs extended integration tests only when new commits exist on testing since the last successful nightly.
steps: Author nightly.yml with schedule trigger (e.g., 0 2 * * *).
Add initial job to fetch testing branch and download previous nightly-state artifact (actions/download-artifact).
Use actions/github-script to compare current HEAD SHA against stored SHA; set job output changed=true/false.
Wrap the heavy matrix jobs with if: steps.changed == 'true' to skip when no changes occurred.
After a successful run, upload nightly-state.json containing the processed commit SHA.
Add failure handler using peter-evans/create-issue-from-file to open actionable issues.

tasks.title: Relax seccomp on musl while retaining Linux isolation
tasks.description: Update the world crate so musl targets skip the libseccomp baseline yet emit a warning, keeping cross builds and releases green without sacrificing glibc coverage.
steps: Gate libseccomp dependency to non-musl Linux targets in Cargo.toml.
Wrap seccomp baseline logic in cfg guards and add a musl-friendly noop implementation that logs a warning.
Verify cross builds for x86_64-unknown-linux-musl succeed locally or via CI.
Document the constraint in RELEASE_PIPELINE_PLAN.md and update task logs.

tasks.title: Adopt cargo-dist for release planning and packaging
tasks.description: Initialise cargo-dist, customise packaging configuration, and commit reproducible templates for multi-platform builds.
steps: Install cargo-dist locally and run cargo dist init at repository root.
Edit dist/cargo-dist.toml to list targets (linux x86_64/aarch64, macOS arm64/x86_64, Windows x86_64).
Configure extra artifact packaging for shared docs/scripts (support tarball).
Author a release template referencing CHANGELOG sections and quickstart docs.
Rewrite shell/PowerShell installers to fetch per-app cargo-dist archives and reconstruct the legacy layout.
Commit the dist/ directory (excluding generated artifacts via .gitignore).
Run dist plan --ci github --output-format=json locally to validate configuration.

tasks.title: Regenerate release workflow to plan/build/upload artifacts
tasks.description: Replace the manual release.yml with cargo-dist plan/build/upload jobs and optional crates.io publishing.
steps: Overwrite release.yml with cargo-dist generated workflow, ensuring triggers include push tags v* and workflow_dispatch.
Add plan job (Ubuntu) that emits dist-manifest.json artifact.
Create build matrix job using cargo dist build for each target and attach smoke validations.
Add publish job that runs cargo dist upload with RELEASE permissions.
Gate crates.io publishing behind manual approval using environment protection if kept.
Remove redundant archive-upload steps from the legacy workflow.

tasks.title: Automate testing→main promotions
tasks.description: Provide a reusable workflow that fast-forwards main from testing once CI is green and optionally tags a release.
steps: Create promote.yml with workflow_dispatch inputs (tag name, dry-run).
Checkout testing and main with fetch-depth: 0.
Verify latest testing commit has passing CI using actions/github-script.
Fast-forward main to testing (git merge --ff-only).
Optionally create annotated tag when requested and push.
Emit summary instructions for initiating release workflow.

tasks.title: Apply GitHub branch protections and environment rules
tasks.description: Enforce the documented branch model so only testing promotions can update main and only release workflow can publish artifacts.
steps: Enable protections on testing and main requiring status checks from ci-testing.yml and approvals.
Disable force push and direct pushes to main; allow admins to push in emergencies only if desired.
Create production environment in Actions with required reviewers and restrict deployment branches to main.
Document the settings in docs/CONFIGURATION.md for future reference.

tasks.title: Update developer documentation for the new pipeline
tasks.description: Ensure all contributor guides reference the updated workflows and promotion process.
steps: Describe the feature → testing → main promotion path in docs/DEVELOPMENT.md.
Record workflow names, triggers, and required CLI commands in docs/CONFIGURATION.md.
Add quickstart instructions for running dist plan locally prior to tagging.
Link to the nightly skip logic documentation for troubleshooting.

tasks.title: Execute end-to-end dry run and validate outputs
tasks.description: Run the complete pipeline using a non-production tag to confirm artifact publishing, nightly skip logic, and promotion workflow behaviour.
steps: Create temporary tag v0.0.0-ci-smoke from testing and push.
Observe release.yml execution, confirm artifacts and release notes.
Trigger nightly workflow twice: once after a code change (should run), once without changes (should skip heavy jobs).
Invoke promote.yml in dry-run mode to confirm guardrails.
Document results and open issues for any deviations.

tasks.title: Audit legacy installers and define packaging requirements
tasks.description: Study the scripts from commit e350bdb (Linux/macOS shell + Windows PowerShell) to enumerate every artifact, dependency, and service the one-command installer must provision.
steps: List all binaries/scripts consumed by the legacy install flow (substrate, world-agent, forwarder, support tarball).
Describe how macOS (Lima) and Windows (WSL) expect the guest agent to be installed and managed.
Capture gaps between the automated release and installer expectations; update RELEASE_PIPELINE_PLAN.md with acceptance criteria.

tasks.title: Publish world-agent, forwarder, and support assets via release.yml
tasks.description: Extend dist/release configuration so every artifact the installer needs is attached to GitHub releases.
steps: Model world-agent, substrate-forwarder, and host-proxy as dist apps so tag builds emit per-crate archives for every required target.
Add a bundler job in release.yml that stitches those outputs (plus substrate-support.{tar.gz,zip}) into a single archive per host target and generates SHA rows.
Upload only the per-target bundles + support archives to the GitHub Release while retaining per-crate outputs as workflow artifacts; document the download locations.

tasks.title: Update installers to consume automated release artifacts
tasks.description: Refresh install-substrate.{sh,ps1} (and uninstall helpers) so they download artifacts from GitHub Releases instead of local release folders, then re-run smoke tests across Linux/macOS/Windows.
steps: Wire the installers to fetch the single host bundle + support archive for their platform and verify checksums before unpacking.
Re-enable Lima/WSL provisioning logic and ensure systemd services are registered.
Document verification commands (doctor/smoke) and update tasks JSON with the run results.
